meanings.definition: Tectrices: plural form of tectrix, a feather covering or plume on a bird
meanings.sent1: The colorful tectrices of the peacock help attract a mate.
meanings.sent2: Birds use their tectrices to regulate body temperature and aid in flight.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to steal the tectrices from the sleeping bird.
meanings.sent4: Her tectrices fluttered in the wind like delicate flags of freedom.
meanings.sent5: The tectrices of the eagle gleamed in the sunlight, a majestic sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Tectrices: protective coverings or layers, especially in reference to the skin or outer surface of an organism
meanings.sent1: The thick tectrices of the armadillo shield it from predators.
meanings.sent2: The tectrices of the plant help retain moisture and protect it from harsh weather.
meanings.sent3: The knight wore tectrices made of shining metal to deflect enemy blows.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a tectrices against the sadness that threatened to engulf her.
meanings.sent5: The thick tectrices of the tortoise were like a natural armor, keeping it safe from harm.
